title: Viktor Demyanenko
text:
Viktor Leonidovich Demyanenko () (born August 26, 1958 in <a href="Alma-Ata">Alma-Ata</a>, <a href="Kazakh%20SSR">Kazakh SSR</a>) is a retired <a href="boxing">boxer</a>, who represented the <a href="Soviet%20Union">USSR</a> at the <a href="Boxing%20at%20the%201980%20Summer%20Olympics">1980 Summer Olympics</a> in <a href="Moscow">Moscow</a>, <a href="Soviet%20Union">Soviet Union</a>. There he won the silver medal in the <a href="lightweight">lightweight</a> division (– 60 kg), after being defeated in the final by <a href="Cuba">Cuba</a>'s <a href="%C3%81ngel%20Herrera%20Vera">Ángel Herrera</a>. Demyanenko trained at <a href="Dynamo%20%28sports%20society%29">Dynamo</a> in <a href="Alma-Ata">Alma-Ata</a>. He won gold at the <a href="1979%20European%20Amateur%20Boxing%20Championships">1979 European Championship</a>. During his career Demyanenko won 267 fights out of 290.
